rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Meredith is awesome! She's a doctoral student, and understands the undergraduate struggle. super nice, easy to get along with, hilarious, superb teacher, speaks clearly and is easy to understand even though the course is completely in spanish. Couldn't recommend more.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: She was okay. I'm a native speaker & was expecting more from her class. Even though she's Spanish she would sometimes use English and it was fairly annoying for a 200 level class where we're supposed to use the opportunity to improve our pronunciation. Class requires lots of reading. She's very nice and approachable! Work hard & you'll get an A.

I hate literature, but she made it pretty enjoyable. She is one hundred percent there for you and will save your butt if you go to office hours. I still go back and ask her for help! She is really sweet and although she isn't always the best at english, she will meet you halfway. I'm terrible with analysis and she really helped.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Course is taught only in Spanish, not allowed to use English in class. Tough grader compared to other sections but consistent across students and assignments in his class. You can tell he loves Spanish and teaching it, very helpful if you go to office hours.
Enthusiastic about Spanish and very helpful. Best professor I had that semester. My Spanish Lab sucks, but it's required and professor can't control that.
He's pretty easy and as a grad student he's not too strict on us. He can't control what he assigns because it's the same for all 105 but he makes the class fun.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Dr. Gravatt really loves the material and class always fly by because she keeps it interesting. She definitely didn't grade the in class composition or the interview very harshly, which was nice.

I love Dr. Gravatt! Her instructions and expectations are always very clear, and you'll learn a lot in her class without sacrificing your GPA. She's actually the reason I'm considering pursuing a minor in Spanish! Highly recommend taking a class with her, especially Spanish 203.
She is so knowledgeable and willing to help! She is funny and makes the class interesting. I highly recommend her!

Horrible professor. Anyone with any knowledge of Spanish can tell that she's bad at it. Speaks with a valley girl accent and acts like an air head. I don't know how she became a teacher, but she's awful, idiotic, and annoying.

She is nice, helpful, and funny! She tries to make Spanish fun and interesting! She uses the textbook activities a fair amount in class so make sure you bring it with you! I recommend her as a teacher!
Dr. Gravatt is rude and uninformative.
Funny, intelligent, and very beautiful! Dr. Gravatt makes learning Spanish fun with her knowledge and desire to spread the language. Truly a person comfortable in their own skin!

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: KH was a great professor. He is very funny and always encouraged us to participate in class. He does get visibly upset when people don't participate in class, but he notices improvements, and they will show up in your grade. Gives a lot of very easy quizzes so those can be helpful. Always willing to offer help in office hours.

I had Huer for 105, which covers Span 101 & 102 in one semester. Therefore, we covered a LOT of material. However, he made it very enjoyable! Huer really wanted us all to participate and do well in his class. Also, he can be really funny and is sure to make you laugh! His English is a little hard to understand, but his Spanish is on point.

His class is gonna be fast paced as he is remarkably fluid in Spanish, but it'll be relatively OK if you actually participate. He takes that part really seriously, and as a result his Spanish classes are usually more social than others.

In-class participation is a must. Prof. Huer is enthusiastic and funny in class! But he's not always clear and many times doesn't understand your questions (especially in English). Not a bad professor, but not the best either.
He is an awesome teacher, really funny in class and makes Spanish-speaking environment not terrifying. Can be a little difficult to understand in English, but his tests are easy.
This guy is hilarious, I would be giggling the whole class. He is super enthusiastic in his little asian man way. Love this teacher and he made my first spanish class soooo good!
Huer's class is easy you just read the book, do online homework every night, and take oral exams. He's really big on participation. There is no final exam- just a group video project

Professor Huer is extremely helpful, funny, understanding and nice.  His spanish is slightly mumbled at times & though and his English is not necessarily the best, he is always eager to help students!  There is daily textbook homework that's completed online, which is not complicated. The exams are oral.  The final includes making a 15 min. video
Very nice and helpful, but can be hard to understand at times. The class size is fairly small, and he is pretty good at teaching one on one.
I love his class. He is enthusiastic and funny!

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Dr. Gravatt really loves the material and class always fly by because she keeps it interesting. She definitely didn't grade the in class composition or the interview very harshly, which was nice.

I love Dr. Gravatt! Her instructions and expectations are always very clear, and you'll learn a lot in her class without sacrificing your GPA. She's actually the reason I'm considering pursuing a minor in Spanish! Highly recommend taking a class with her, especially Spanish 203.
She is so knowledgeable and willing to help! She is funny and makes the class interesting. I highly recommend her!

Horrible professor. Anyone with any knowledge of Spanish can tell that she's bad at it. Speaks with a valley girl accent and acts like an air head. I don't know how she became a teacher, but she's awful, idiotic, and annoying.

She is nice, helpful, and funny! She tries to make Spanish fun and interesting! She uses the textbook activities a fair amount in class so make sure you bring it with you! I recommend her as a teacher!
Dr. Gravatt is rude and uninformative.
Funny, intelligent, and very beautiful! Dr. Gravatt makes learning Spanish fun with her knowledge and desire to spread the language. Truly a person comfortable in their own skin!

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Professor Lee is very funny and her class is engaging. She did a good job of making a very boring subject (grammar) pretty interesting. She's prone to go on tangents in class, so be prepared. The class was pretty tough at first, but don't be discouraged because it gets easier. Go to her office hours, she really is there for her students!

Dr. Lee is SO smart and funny.   I was very intimidated after the first day, looking at the syllabus was very overwhelming. We had a paper due on like the third day of class! BUT MAN!!! Once you get used to the work load (which eases up as the semester continues) the class is GREAT!!!! I learned so much and I will take more of her classes.
You can get points taken off for things don't involve your understanding of the material.  Also make sure the Spanish is correct in your papers, the content doesn't matter so much.

Dr. Lee is a cool professor, but can be condescending to all American students. She's traveled a lot and has a lot to share, but puts shame on those who have never been outside the United States and makes you feel ignorant. She's also a pretty funny person too, cracking a joke once in a while. The class was harder than necessary, but still doable..

She is nice and always has interesting stories to tell. But she gives lots of small assignments and pop quizzes that can kill your grade because they are so difficult. She is a good teacher- but spanish 204 is hard and is a huge jump from 203. If coming from high school consider 203 for an easy A.

Quizzes are almost impossible. The information isn't always relevant to what is studied in class. However, she makes the class very enjoyable. She makes you speak in Spanish which is super annoying but helpful! My conversation skills have improved immensely. Just be prepared for hard quizzes and tests. The grammar handbook has examples that help.

Span 102 online- The book is not very helpful IMO because i doesn't give enough examples. That makes actually doing the classwork and homework necessary if you really want to understand the material. Ambiciones Siniestras is ok, if your really good at understanding the long paragraphs and fast talking in videos. Overall, class participation is key.

The worksheets and the PowerPoints were really helpful.  The book was not helpful to me at all.  Ambiciones siniestras went way too quickly for someone who is learning elementary Spanish.  The tests were pretty straightforward, however, if you spelled something wrong or missed an accent mark, you missed the whole question.  Quizzes were helpful.

The videos in the book she uses are sometimes hard to understand and she texts and quizes you on it. There is very little accountability for completing the worksheets which makes you less likely to work on it all week. One class a week is not much either so its easy to put it off. Power points and class are very helpful and cover everything.

The online testsquizzes do not give partial credit and count the answer completely wrong for the smallest mistakes. I liked the worksheets because they helped me follow along with class because I do not work well under pressure of being randomly called on. The professor was very helpful and clear. Overall, great class.

The stuff that helped me within this class was the pronunciation quizzes and powerpoints. The pronunciation quizzes allowed me to see how well I spoke Spanish, which helped a lot. I was thankful the powerpoints were available because sometimes the textbook made the grammar hard to understand but the powerpoints broke it down better.

SPAN 102-Online The powerpoint and worksheets helped me because I could follow along with the class without being put completely on the spot. The videos from the textbook did not help because they went too fast and I could not really understand the story. Unfortunately  testsquizzes do not give partial credit. Overall, I really enjoyed the class.

I had a bad experience with SPAN 204 and SPAN 255 professors and almost began to hate Spanish. However, after having Professor Lee, I've remembered why I love Spanish so much. She's amazing, funny, has a lot of insight on the world through her travels, and a great lecturer. Class is generally difficult, I guess, but she helps you along the way. 55

She's an awesome professor! She has traveled everywhere and can really give you a lot of insight about various countries and interesting facts. If you come to class & try to participate as much as possible, you'll do well. You can tell she loves what she does. The class was at 9am and she was always enthusiastic. She's really sweet. TAKE HER CLASS!

The cultural information provided both before and after the viewing of each movie is very helpful to understanding some of the sayings and humor that appears. It also allows for the student to relate better to the Spanish culture.

Sra. Lee is one of the best professors at UNC. If you have a chance to take a class with her, do it! She genuinely loves her job and that is demonstrated through her teaching. This class does require a significant amount of time outside of class watching movies and completing book exercises.
Professor Lee is great! She is very knowledgable, and always keeps class interesting.
Professor Lee is one of the best Spanish professors I've had at UNC. The content of the class is already really interesting but her comments make it even more enjoyable.
The professor keeps this class interesting with additional information about real life events relating to the movies. Her office hours are flexible and she is available if you need help.

I like this class a lot. Not only is it an advanced level course allowing for fluent conversation in SPanish, the information and history we are learning by watching the films is very interesting. If you like to speak spanish, learn spanish history, and practice a lot-you will do fine and enjoy the class!

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Meredith is awesome! She's a doctoral student, and understands the undergraduate struggle. super nice, easy to get along with, hilarious, superb teacher, speaks clearly and is easy to understand even though the course is completely in spanish. Couldn't recommend more.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Prof. Kim is super nice and loves helping his students learn! His tests are pretty tough. I've taken two classes with him (thinking I could pull an A off the second time and got a B+). Oral interview is graded tough and he doesn't give late forgiveness. If you really want to learn Spanish, take his class. Office hours are stellar!!

I did not like professor Kim at all as a teacher.  He is a very nice person but he grades really tough and does not give helpful feedback.  He expects the students to know things that my friend in 203 didn't even know.  His expectations are ridiculous and his exams were the hardest I've ever taken.  My advice: take another professor.

Professor Kim is a great lecturer, but seems to be very unorganized. He is usually very helpful if you go to office hours or come to him with questions in class, but he didn't return any of our assignments on time and fell behind on assigning our oral interviews by an entire week.

While I think Professor Kim is a great teacher for 100-204 Spanish classes, I would caution anyone taking his class for levels 260 or higher. Professor Kim expects a lot from his students and is not very clear in his teachings or instructions to students on assignments.
Great professor. Period.

He is an amazing teacher. Super passionate. If you have questions when you have doubt he will make it clear however he can. Really animated and made class fun. Do outside reading because he discusses everything in class. Office hours are super helpful as well.

Dr. Kim really is a great teacher. He's very passionate about teaching Spanish. He does sometimes make a point when people are wrong, but he doesn't mean to humiliate anyone. He is a good teacher who truly cares that his students learn the material. I would recommend him for 102. (Took it during Summer Session)

U took his hybrid class so I was a little hesitant but it wasn't that bad at all. He really is a nice guy and tries to make the class as interesting as possible. It was shocking how much I learned in a 50 min session. The thing about his class is that everything is evenly distributed so even if you mess up you can make it up. He truly cares!

Not enough speaking. Class did not meet often enough to get a useful grasp on the language. Although English is not his first language, he is easy to understand. Helpful. I strongly dislike the use of online teaching tools - now I can read and write Spanish, but am barely above 101 level in speaking. Very disappointing semester.

He may be OK for 101-204 but I would avoid higher levels with him. He made this class so ridiculously hard. Not to mention boring. And the reviewer who mentioned that he makes a scene when you're wrong about something - spot on. He enjoys pointing out the minutest of his students' mistakes, but the thing is, he makes plenty of them himself! Avoid.

Kim is an okay professor, he is very militant in his teaching style, the main reason I score him low is that when you answer incorrectly he makes a big scene and you feel so dumb for not know the answer. other then that he is a pretty good guy

dr.kim is so passionate about teaching, and it is apparent in his approach. he is quite thorough in his lectures and speaks clearly so that he may be understood. i enjoyed his class a lot - he used powerpoints frequently to coincide with his lectures.i would definitely recommend dr.kim to anyone who wants to become fluent in spanish
He's very animated and loves to teach. Great guy, quite entertaining. The subject matter is kind of a bore, but he tries to make it interesting and fun.

Great professor.  Very enthusiastic, and makes spanish... which i hate, prett fun.  Not a hard professor, there is a midterm, a "mini" midterm, and a final, plus participation and a presentation grade.  An overall nice guy.  A little weird at first because he has a korean accent but I got used to it.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Course is taught only in Spanish, not allowed to use English in class. Tough grader compared to other sections but consistent across students and assignments in his class. You can tell he loves Spanish and teaching it, very helpful if you go to office hours.
Enthusiastic about Spanish and very helpful. Best professor I had that semester. My Spanish Lab sucks, but it's required and professor can't control that.
He's pretty easy and as a grad student he's not too strict on us. He can't control what he assigns because it's the same for all 105 but he makes the class fun.

She is really sweet and although she isn't always the best at english, she will meet you halfway. I'm terrible with analysis and she really helped.

I love Dr. Gravatt! Her instructions and expectations are always very clear, and you'll learn a lot in her class without sacrificing your GPA. She's actually the reason I'm considering pursuing a minor in Spanish! Highly recommend taking a class with her, especially Spanish 203.
She is so knowledgeable and willing to help! She is funny and makes the class interesting. I highly recommend her!

Horrible professor. Anyone with any knowledge of Spanish can tell that she's bad at it. Speaks with a valley girl accent and acts like an air head. I don't know how she became a teacher, but she's awful, idiotic, and annoying.

She is nice, helpful, and funny! She tries to make Spanish fun and interesting! She uses the textbook activities a fair amount in class so make sure you bring it with you! I recommend her as a teacher!
Dr. Gravatt is rude and uninformative.
Funny, intelligent, and very beautiful! Dr. Gravatt makes learning Spanish fun with her knowledge and desire to spread the language. Truly a person comfortable in their own skin!

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: KH was a great professor. He is very funny and always encouraged us to participate in class. He does get visibly upset when people don't participate in class, but he notices improvements, and they will show up in your grade. Gives a lot of very easy quizzes so those can be helpful. Always willing to offer help in office hours.

I had Huer for 105, which covers Span 101 & 102 in one semester. Therefore, we covered a LOT of material. However, he made it very enjoyable! Huer really wanted us all to participate and do well in his class. Also, he can be really funny and is sure to make you laugh! His English is a little hard to understand, but his Spanish is on point.

His class is gonna be fast paced as he is remarkably fluid in Spanish, but it'll be relatively OK if you actually participate. He takes that part really seriously, and as a result his Spanish classes are usually more social than others.

In-class participation is a must. Prof. Huer is enthusiastic and funny in class! But he's not always clear and many times doesn't understand your questions (especially in English). Not a bad professor, but not the best either.
He is an awesome teacher, really funny in class and makes Spanish-speaking environment not terrifying. Can be a little difficult to understand in English, but his tests are easy.
This guy is hilarious, I would be giggling the whole class. He is super enthusiastic in his little asian man way. Love this teacher and he made my first spanish class soooo good!
Huer's class is easy you just read the book, do online homework every night, and take oral exams. He's really big on participation. There is no final exam- just a group video project

Professor Huer is extremely helpful, funny, understanding and nice.  His spanish is slightly mumbled at times & though and his English is not necessarily the best, he is always eager to help students!  There is daily textbook homework that's completed online, which is not complicated. The exams are oral.  The final includes making a 15 min. video
Very nice and helpful, but can be hard to understand at times. The class size is fairly small, and he is pretty good at teaching one on one.
I love his class. He is enthusiastic and funny!

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Julia Cardona Mack may be my favourite professor at UNC so far, & I'm a Bio major (what are you doing, Evans, Burch & Steinwand?). She cares so much about her students, and even though she expects you to learn a lot on your own, she's still willing to help you out. She takes her time to read your papers and she's really into Physics, too! 10/10.

I strongly dislike Prof. Mack and she most definitely dislikes me. She's very unclear about everything, assigns busy work, which is the bane of my existence, talks about culture all day but does grammar heavy tests and will not let you make up graded in class activities if you miss, even if you have a note. Am personally never taking ever again.

One of the best and nicest professors I've had at UNC. She mostly speaks in Spanish, but will use English if you really need it. Classes were usually pretty energetic and helpful. Tests were generally pretty easy. Participation hinges on both class activities and an oral presentation with a partner.

Good teacher, great person. Really enjoyed being in her class. Span 203 was very easy for me and the workload was fairly light. I definitely recommend taking her class. Nicest professor I've had so far. Do the msl assignments ahead of time and remember when the Letras quizzes are.

She is just so incredibly disorganized and changes her mind so often it's not even funny. I did well in the class, but I just spent a lot of time frustrated at her. She's also really biased when she grades, so you better agree with her opinion. She is just so frustrating. No, just no.

She really cares about her students and has them do lots of group projects to promote collaboration.  There's homework almost every class, but it's not a lot.  Tests are from readings of stories and vocab words.  She's off topic a lot, or just talks.

She is a really nice lady, but I didn't like her as a teacher.  She is a native of Puerto Rico, and she has several language and linguistics degrees.  This course was a culture course.  She assigned large amounts of reading or group presentations the night before.  We didn't have a text book so she would find research studies and email them to us.
Unorganized, changes her mind.  Comes across as nice and fun.  Made classmates cry.  Waste of my time at UNC.
This was very unstructured and unorganized. Assignments were random and never clearly explained. The class seemed very interesting at first but was not what I expected.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Best professor at UNC. Classes are easy and his lectures are highly academical. He is very lay back but really cares about his student .
Alan was a great professor. He connects with students and keeps things reasonable. I wish I had taken more classes with him.
it was very entertaining having alan as a professor. he is very nice and knowledgable. the class is very laid back

I would say this is definitely the professor to take if you're just trying to finish your FL credit. He makes tests as easy as he can (listening sections) and doesn't assign much homework, especially toward the end of the semester. However, if you want to actually learn Spanish, he's probably not the best choice. He's pretty confusing sometimes

He's very easy. If you're serious about learning Spanish, I'd say that you should opt for someone a little more difficult. If you don't care about learning and just want FL credit, he's the man for you. Very little homework, very easy grading on the tests.

If you take this class and do the work (basic worksheet style), you will pass. This class, however, was awful to sit through. Despite talking in English a LOT, he was still impossible to understand when he taught grammar. Does not finish sentences!! He ended up waxing philosophical the whole time... and being rather rude when students didn't agree.
Prof Re is awesome. He really knows the subject and you can ask him any question. Very flexible and open. He really helps a lot.

Professor Re**** is easy going, very relax and knowledgeable. He doesn't teach much yet he guides well. I only needed a D to graduate and was not planning to study much, however, I did a lot of homework without even being aware. His class was super fun and I learned a great deal. Highly recommend his class!
Redik is a SUPER EASY teacher, and pretty chill. however, he refuses to teach actual spanish. A nice guy, though.

Prof. Re**** is hard. At the first part of the semeste he kills you with homeworks but then you set you free. He lets you work on your own terms. I ended with an A and I was expecting a C+ hen I started. He knows what he is doing.

This is the easiest professor I have ever had at Carolina. HOWEVER, he will not teach you anything. He refuses to help in class and tells people to look up answers online instead. I want to minor in Spanish and if you want to learn at all DO NOT take this class.
Great professor. Very intelligent and extremely knowledgeable. The discussions are highly philosophical and he will help you a lot with your grammar.
Alan is the man. He grades great, but he will teach if you are interested. He helped me out when I asked. He only cares about grammar when you write compositions, not so much subject matter.

Pretty cool guy. The readings are really hard of you are coming from SPAN 204. They are do-able though. He gives a lot of help on what to know for the test so pay attention on review days! Grades pretty easily.
Alan Re**** is the bomb. His class was easy and he really tried hard to help you make good grades. On the downside he can be a bit flighty, so don't expect your papers or tests back anytime soon.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Julia Cardona Mack may be my favourite professor at UNC so far, & I'm a Bio major (what are you doing, Evans, Burch & Steinwand?). She cares so much about her students, and even though she expects you to learn a lot on your own, she's still willing to help you out. She assigned large amounts of reading or group presentations the night before.  We didn't have a text book so she would find research studies and email them to us.
Unorganized, changes her mind.  Comes across as nice and fun.  Made classmates cry.  Waste of my time at UNC.
This was very unstructured and unorganized. Assignments were random and never clearly explained. The class seemed very interesting at first but was not what I expected.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Alex slays the spanish game.

After taking spanish since middle school, I can honestly say that Alex is by far the best spanish teacher I ever had. She is great at making sure everyone understands the material. The class was never boring because of Alex's fun personality. Highly recommend taking a class taught by her!

Alex is a fantastic teacher! She's very chill and extremely helpful if you stay after class or go to office hours. Make sure to attend class ( after like 3 absences you get points taken off your grade- department policy). Culture and Letras are a key part of the final exam.

Amazing professor. Laid back, chill. Understands needs of the students and works with you to get the best grade possible. Definitely not a pushover but very helpful. Speaking Spanish in class is NOT mandatory but some Spanish is expected. Complete the MySpanishLabs. For exams, KNOWING the Letras and Vistazo Cultural sections are crucial to passing.

Alex is one of the nicest teachers that I have had at UNC. She makes class fun and interesting. She is tough though and fully expects you to put forth your best effort. You have to do a lot of outside work to learn much of the material.

Alex is awesome and a good professor. Everything is reasonable and if you study a decent amount, you'll be fine. She has tattoos, purple hair, and always dresses really cool. She also makes a lot of jokes and we play games in class that actually help me learn the material. I would love to have her again!

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Alex slays the spanish game.

After taking spanish since middle school, I can honestly say that Alex is by far the best spanish teacher I ever had. She is great at making sure everyone understands the material. The class was never boring because of Alex's fun personality. Highly recommend taking a class taught by her!

Alex is a fantastic teacher! She's very chill and extremely helpful if you stay after class or go to office hours. Make sure to attend class ( after like 3 absences you get points taken off your grade- department policy). Culture and Letras are a key part of the final exam.

She also makes a lot of jokes and we play games in class that actually help me learn the material. I would love to have her again!

Redik is a SUPER EASY teacher, and pretty chill. however, he refuses to teach actual spanish. A nice guy, though.

Prof. Re**** is hard. At the first part of the semeste he kills you with homeworks but then you set you free. He lets you work on your own terms. I ended with an A and I was expecting a C+ hen I started. He knows what he is doing.

This is the easiest professor I have ever had at Carolina. HOWEVER, he will not teach you anything. He refuses to help in class and tells people to look up answers online instead. I want to minor in Spanish and if you want to learn at all DO NOT take this class.
Great professor. Very intelligent and extremely knowledgeable. The discussions are highly philosophical and he will help you a lot with your grammar.
Alan is the man. He grades great, but he will teach if you are interested. He helped me out when I asked. He only cares about grammar when you write compositions, not so much subject matter.

Pretty cool guy. The readings are really hard of you are coming from SPAN 204. They are do-able though. He gives a lot of help on what to know for the test so pay attention on review days! Grades pretty easily.
Alan Re**** is the bomb. His class was easy and he really tried hard to help you make good grades. On the downside he can be a bit flighty, so don't expect your papers or tests back anytime soon.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: She is literally the best. She is so nice, and she is so helpful. TAKE HER!!! She is also beautiful :)

Amaia is awesome.  It's not impossible to do well because she is really willing to help out students, but you have to show interest for her to show interest.  Participation is a big part of how you will do.  Talk only in Spanish and participate and you will do well.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: She is literally the best. She is so nice, and she is so helpful. TAKE HER!!! She is also beautiful :)

Amaia is awesome.  It's not impossible to do well because she is really willing to help out students, but you have to show interest for her to show interest.  Participation is a big part of how you will do.  Talk only in Spanish and participate and you will do well.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: She is a pretty tough grader - compared to my SPAN105 teacher, she was MUCH more difficult. Extremely hard on participation grades - didn't let me "make up" credit when I was in the HOSPITAL (though I did end up with a 90, after going to class every single time afterwards and participating my ass off). However she is fluent and gives great info.

She is a pretty strict grader, especially compared to the other SPAN 203 teachers. She does not explain why she marks off most of the time when you ask her. She also marks down on the entire class for participation grade, which should be an automatic A if you pay attention and show up to class. However, she does not treat it like this.

I thought the class was really easy. Especially for the 4th level of college spanish. yeah she gives a lot of quizzes but they are incredibly easy. she tests and grades really fairly. the assignments are pretty easy too. she isn't the most helpful professor but she is nice and you should pull an A or B with little effort

The reading is what's killer--expect a fair amount of homework every night. The analyzing isn't that bad once you get used to it, but if you don't pay attention in class you're screwed on the tests! Expect questions on exact quotations, themes, authors, time periods, cultural differences between countries, etc.

Assigns a lot of homework, especially nights before tests, so on top of studying for an exam, you have to worry about doing the assignments. Quizzes and in class essays almost everyday in class. Impractical grading scale-do better on in class rough draft comps verses final drafts. Does not make herself accessible for outside help. Avoid this class!

She's really nice and the class is pretty easy, especially if you have a good background in Spanish and can put together a half-decent essay. I think its as interesting as you make it- if you read and think about it, class is a lot more interesting because you will have more to add.

She's a mediocre teacher. She's good about sensing whether or not class is ready for upcoming tests, etc. and she'll change dates around. Do the homework. She's not that easy, but at this level, easiness shouldn't really be expected. Overall, the class isn't that bad.
She is a good teacher but she is not an easy one. If you want to continue on further in spanish then take her.
She's a fair grader and will postpone quizzes or speak in English if she can tell the class isn't doing well.  She's cool.
No Comments
